articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Late Chen Lei 
   Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Dec. 5 sent a wreath to the bier of the late Chen Lei, anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter and former governor of Heilongjiang Province of China, expressing deep condolences over his death.
 Kim Jong Il sent a message of condolence to Chen's widow.    
 Upon hearing the sad news that Comrade Chen Lei died of long illness to our sorrow, I express profound condolences to the bereaved family of the deceased, the message said.

articles.content:
DPRK Proves Successful in 15th Asiad 
   Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- DPRK gymnast Ri Se Gwang clinched the gold in the men's vault finals of the 15th Asian Games on Dec. 6, with a score of 16.625 points.
 DPRK rowers placed second to bag the silver medal in the women's coxed fours on the same day.    
 Meanwhile, the DPRK came first in group f to clinch a berth in the quarter-finals of the men's football tournament after beating Japan 2:1 in group league matches.

articles.title: General Meeting of European Regional Committee Held
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Lao Ambassador 
   Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Chanpheng Sihaphom, Lao ambassador to the DPRK who paid a farewell call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
 Present there were officials concerned and staff members of the Lao embassy here.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Hugo Chavez Frias
Bush's Malarkey Ridiculed
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Hugo Chavez Frias 
   Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Hugo Chavez Frias on his reelection as President of Venezuela amid the absolute support and trust of the Venezuelan people.
 The message said that his reelection is a striking manifestation of the firm will of the Venezuelan people to advance along the road of independence against imperialism under his right guidance.    
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries forged in the anti-imperialist united front would boost overall in conformity with the aspiration and interests of the two peoples, the message wholeheartedly wished him greater success in his responsible work for defending national dignity and achieving prosperity of the country.

Greetings to PM of Tajikistan
   Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Akil Akilov on his remaining in office as Prime Minister of Tajikistan.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the interests of the two peoples, the message wished him success in his work.
